Sentencas: A distance propagation method is presented for calculating tortuosity with relatively low computation time from three-dimensional (3D) tomographic data.
Titulo: Tortuosity characterization of 3D microstructure at nano-scale for energy storage and conversion materials

Sentencas: Moreover, a novel concept of tortuosity distribution is developed to provide a more comprehensive picture of inhomogeneous microstructures where tortuosity depends on the actual 3D paths.
Titulo: Tortuosity characterization of 3D microstructure at nano-scale for energy storage and conversion materials

Sentencas: Instead of using one single tortuosity value, the tortuosity distribution both as spatial distribution map and also statistic histogram can provide a more complete description.
Titulo: Tortuosity characterization of 3D microstructure at nano-scale for energy storage and conversion materials

Sentencas: The method, which can be applied to any porous medium, is tested against a diffusion-based tortuosity calculation on two 3D microstructures: a LiCoO2 cathode electrode of lithium ion battery measured by x-ray nano-tomography and a lanthanum strontium rnanganite-ttria-stabilized zirconia, solid oxide fuel cells cathode measured using focused ion beam-scanning electron microscopy serial sectioning.
Titulo: Tortuosity characterization of 3D microstructure at nano-scale for energy storage and conversion materials

Sentencas: The present method is shown to provide good-agreement with the effective diffusion-based tortuosity values.
Titulo: Tortuosity characterization of 3D microstructure at nano-scale for energy storage and conversion materials
